newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asian dollar deposits narrowly mixed before ECI.
newsitem.headline: Asian dollar deposits narrowly mixed before ECI.

text.p: Asian dollar deposit rates were narrowly mixed in dull trade on Tuesday, dealers said.
Most traders were sidelined before today's issue of the U.S. second quarter employment cost index (ECI) and July consumer confidence index data, they said.

"The market was quiet and featureless except for some light activity at the short end. There no fresh news this morning but some traders are waiting for today's issue of the employment cost index and (July) consumer confidence index figures," a local dealer said.
"Everyone is waiting for the numbers to see if there are any signs of inflation and for more clues to market direction," he said.

In short dates, Tuesday/Wednesday was unchanged from Monday's 5-9/16 5-7/16 percent, Wednesday/Thursday rose 1/8 percentage point to 5-11/16 5-9/16 and week-fixed was unchanged at 5-5/8 5-1/2 percent.

Among term rates, one-month eased 1/16 point to 5-5/8 5-1/2 percent, three-months was unchanged at 5-11/16 5-9/16, nine-months unchanged at 5-7/8 5-3/4 and twelve-months unchanged at 5-15/16 5-13/16 percent. - P. Theseira (65-870-3085)
